definition: to transcribe/to make a fair copy

sentences.english: The demand is that the composition (should) be written on one side only.
sentences.chinese: 按照要求作文必须单面誊写。

sentences.english: She jotted down a few notes, but later mistranscribed them into an exercise book.
sentences.chinese: 她草草做了些笔记，但后来错误的誊写在练习本上了。

sentences.english: The compressed symbol allowed the transcriber to complete the letter in a single stroke.
sentences.chinese: 这个压扁的符号让誊写者用单笔划结束书信。

sentences.english: Then the recordings were transcribed as the base for analysis.
sentences.chinese: 随后录音被誊写出来作为分析的依据。

sentences.english: Many students can't even read, not to mention write, traditional full-form Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 很多门生乃至不能欣赏繁体汉字，更别提誊写了。

sentences.english: The three lines of the inscription have been transcribed and interpreted in various ways.
sentences.chinese: 三行碑文被不同方式誊写和诠释。

sentences.english: Scribe notes are latex transcriptions by students as part of class work.
sentences.chinese: 讲稿是以课堂作业的形式由学生所誊写。

sentences.english: Pre-Authenticated Document A status in which a document is transcribed but not authenticated.
sentences.chinese: 认证前文件文件已经誊写但尚未认证的状态。

definition: to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
to read through to evaluate/to referee
to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
to mark (homework, exam scripts etc)/to correct and criticize (an article)/to check/to correct/a correction (to a piece of writing)
